CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Integration of the two distinct peaks for all random terpolymers was consistent with the feed ratio of DPP to TPD. The compositions of different terpolymers were also measured by elemental analysis and both values show good agreement. Thermal Properties. The thermal stability of the polymers was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) , as shown in Figure S2. The TGA revealed that the decomposition temperatures ( T d ) of P1-P7 ( 5% weight loss ) are 405 , 407 , 413 , 417 , 433 , 433 , and 444 째C , respectively. Thus , the thermal stability of the polymers improved as the amount of TPD increased. All of the polymers exhibited excellent thermal stability , which is important for their applications in PSCs and other optoelectronic devices. 35,36 Optical Properties. The optical properties of all the polymers in dilute chloroform solutions and thin films are shown in Figure 2 and summarized in Table 2. All the random terpolymers exhibited multiple absorption bands ranging from 300 to 900 nm , a common feature of polymers based on donor and acceptor units. 37 In addition , all polymers showed broader absorption in thin films compared to in solution due to stronger interchain aggregation. 28 The optical band gaps of P1-P7 were estimated to be 1.38 , 1.38 , 1.40 , 1.42 , 1.49 , 1.55 , and 1.85 eV , respectively , based on the onset of the light absorption. The absorption onset of P7 was blue - shifted compared to P1 , which was due to the weaker electronwithdrawing character of TPD compared to DPP. Upon comparison of the absorption onset of P2-P6 , a similar trend was observed with a gradual blue - shift from P2 to P6 with higher TPD content. In addition , the increased amount of TPD caused the appearance of a new absorption band around 500- 600 nm , which can be attributed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) band from BDTT to TPD. On the other hand , the absorption band around 700-800 nm , the ICT band from BDTT to DPP , gradually decreased as the content of TPD increased. By regulating the composition of the electrondeficient units , broad absorptions of the random copolymers , P2-P6 were observed from 400 to 900 nm compared to the parent polymers , P1 and P7 , indicating that incorporating two different electron - deficient units into polymer backbone is an effective method to broaden the absorption band and control the optical band gap. Electrochemical Properties. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels of the polymers were determined by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) measurements ( Figure 3 ). All CV measurements were recorded in a solution of 0.1 M Bu 4 NPF 6 in nitrogen - saturated anhydrous acetonitrile at a scanning rate of 50 mV / s. The results of the electrochemical measurements are listed in Table 2.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

1. DPP (donor unit) - mentioned in the following sentences: "the feed ratio of DPP to TPD" and "the TGA revealed that the decomposition temperatures (TD) of P1-P7 (5% weight loss) are 405, 407, 413, 417, 433, 433, and 444 째C, respectively."
2. TPD (acceptor unit) - mentioned in the same sentences as DPP: "the feed ratio of DPP to TPD" and "the TGA revealed that the decomposition temperatures (TD) of P1-P7 (5% weight loss) are 405, 407, 413, 417, 433, 433, and 444 째C, respectively."
3. P1-P7 (random terpolymers) - mentioned in the following sentence: "The thermal stability of the polymers was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) , as shown in Figure S2."
4. BDTT (bridge unit) - mentioned in the following sentence: "In addition, the absorption band around 700-800 nm, the ICT band from BDTT to DPP, gradually decreased as the content of TPD increased."

So, the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. DPP
2. TPD
3. P1-P7
4. BDTT
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! My apologies for including irrelevant entities earlier. Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph:

1. DPP
2. TPD

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid Material Name entities in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DPP |
| TPD |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Integration of the two distinct peaks for all random terpolymers was consistent with the feed ratio of DPP to TPD. The compositions of different terpolymers were also measured by elemental analysis and both values show good agreement. Thermal Properties. The thermal stability of the polymers was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) , as shown in Figure S2. The TGA revealed that the decomposition temperatures ( T d ) of P1-P7 ( 5% weight loss ) are 405 , 407 , 413 , 417 , 433 , 433 , and 444 째C , respectively. Thus , the thermal stability of the polymers improved as the amount of TPD increased. All of the polymers exhibited excellent thermal stability , which is important for their applications in PSCs and other optoelectronic devices. 35,36 Optical Properties. The optical properties of all the polymers in dilute chloroform solutions and thin films are shown in Figure 2 and summarized in Table 2. All the random terpolymers exhibited multiple absorption bands ranging from 300 to 900 nm , a common feature of polymers based on donor and acceptor units. 37 In addition , all polymers showed broader absorption in thin films compared to in solution due to stronger interchain aggregation. 28 The optical band gaps of P1-P7 were estimated to be 1.38 , 1.38 , 1.40 , 1.42 , 1.49 , 1.55 , and 1.85 eV , respectively , based on the onset of the light absorption. The absorption onset of P7 was blue - shifted compared to P1 , which was due to the weaker electronwithdrawing character of TPD compared to DPP. Upon comparison of the absorption onset of P2-P6 , a similar trend was observed with a gradual blue - shift from P2 to P6 with higher TPD content. In addition , the increased amount of TPD caused the appearance of a new absorption band around 500- 600 nm , which can be attributed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) band from BDTT to TPD. On the other hand , the absorption band around 700-800 nm , the ICT band from BDTT to DPP , gradually decreased as the content of TPD increased. By regulating the composition of the electrondeficient units , broad absorptions of the random copolymers , P2-P6 were observed from 400 to 900 nm compared to the parent polymers , P1 and P7 , indicating that incorporating two different electron - deficient units into polymer backbone is an effective method to broaden the absorption band and control the optical band gap. Electrochemical Properties. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels of the polymers were determined by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) measurements ( Figure 3 ). All CV measurements were recorded in a solution of 0.1 M Bu 4 NPF 6 in nitrogen - saturated anhydrous acetonitrile at a scanning rate of 50 mV / s. The results of the electrochemical measurements are listed in Table 2.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's identify the property names mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Property Name: Integration of the two distinct peaks
Description: The consistency of the integration of the two distinct peaks for all random terpolymers was observed and recorded.
2. Property Name: Compositions of different terpolymers
Description: The compositions of different terpolymers were measured by elemental analysis, and the results showed good agreement.
3. Property Name: Thermal stability
Description: The thermal stability of the polymers was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis (TGA), and the decomposition temperatures of the polymers were determined.
4. Property Name: Optical properties
Description: The optical properties of all the polymers in dilute chloroform solutions and thin films were observed and recorded, including the absorption bands and optical band gaps.
5. Property Name: Electrochemical properties
Description: The electrochemical properties of the polymers were determined by cyclic voltammetry (CV) measurements, including the HOMO and LUMO energy levels.

Let me know if you need further assistance!
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Of course! Here are the relevant entities that refer to the property names of materials in the paragraph:

1. Property Name: Integration of the two distinct peaks
2. Property Name: Thermal stability
3. Property Name: Optical properties
4. Property Name: Electrochemical properties

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to property names of materials, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Integration of the two distinct peaks |
| Thermal stability |
| Optical properties |

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Integration of the two distinct peaks for all random terpolymers was consistent with the feed ratio of DPP to TPD. The compositions of different terpolymers were also measured by elemental analysis and both values show good agreement. Thermal Properties. The thermal stability of the polymers was investigated by thermogravimetric analysis ( TGA ) , as shown in Figure S2. The TGA revealed that the decomposition temperatures ( T d ) of P1-P7 ( 5% weight loss ) are 405 , 407 , 413 , 417 , 433 , 433 , and 444 째C , respectively. Thus , the thermal stability of the polymers improved as the amount of TPD increased. All of the polymers exhibited excellent thermal stability , which is important for their applications in PSCs and other optoelectronic devices. 35,36 Optical Properties. The optical properties of all the polymers in dilute chloroform solutions and thin films are shown in Figure 2 and summarized in Table 2. All the random terpolymers exhibited multiple absorption bands ranging from 300 to 900 nm , a common feature of polymers based on donor and acceptor units. 37 In addition , all polymers showed broader absorption in thin films compared to in solution due to stronger interchain aggregation. 28 The optical band gaps of P1-P7 were estimated to be 1.38 , 1.38 , 1.40 , 1.42 , 1.49 , 1.55 , and 1.85 eV , respectively , based on the onset of the light absorption. The absorption onset of P7 was blue - shifted compared to P1 , which was due to the weaker electronwithdrawing character of TPD compared to DPP. Upon comparison of the absorption onset of P2-P6 , a similar trend was observed with a gradual blue - shift from P2 to P6 with higher TPD content. In addition , the increased amount of TPD caused the appearance of a new absorption band around 500- 600 nm , which can be attributed to the intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) band from BDTT to TPD. On the other hand , the absorption band around 700-800 nm , the ICT band from BDTT to DPP , gradually decreased as the content of TPD increased. By regulating the composition of the electrondeficient units , broad absorptions of the random copolymers , P2-P6 were observed from 400 to 900 nm compared to the parent polymers , P1 and P7 , indicating that incorporating two different electron - deficient units into polymer backbone is an effective method to broaden the absorption band and control the optical band gap. Electrochemical Properties. The HOMO and LUMO energy levels of the polymers were determined by cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) measurements ( Figure 3 ). All CV measurements were recorded in a solution of 0.1 M Bu 4 NPF 6 in nitrogen - saturated anhydrous acetonitrile at a scanning rate of 50 mV / s. The results of the electrochemical measurements are listed in Table 2.

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Let's go through the values of material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Values of thermal properties:
 * Decomposition temperature (Td) of P1-P7: 405, 407, 413, 417, 433, 433, and 444 째C
2. Values of optical properties:
 * Optical band gaps (Eg) of P1-P7: 1.38, 1.38, 1.40, 1.42, 1.49, 1.55, and 1.85 eV
 * Absorption onset of P7: blue-shifted compared to P1 (due to weaker electron-withdrawing character of TPD compared to DPP)
 * Gradual blue-shift of absorption onset from P2 to P6 with higher TPD content
 * Appearance of a new absorption band around 500-600 nm due to intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) band from BDTT to TPD
 * Gradual decrease of absorption band around 700-800 nm due to ICT band from BDTT to DPP with increasing TPD content
3. Values of electrochemical properties:
 * HOMO and LUMO energy levels of the polymers: determined by cyclic voltammetry (CV) measurements in a solution of 0.1 M Bu4NPF6 in nitrogen-saturated anhydrous acetonitrile at a scanning rate of 50 mV/s. The results of the electrochemical measurements are listed in Table 2.

Note: eV stands for electronvolts, which is a unit of energy.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Of course! Here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given text:

1. "405, 407, 413, 417, 433, 433, and 444 째C" - These are the decomposition temperatures of the polymers.
2. "1.38, 1.38, 1.40, 1.42, 1.49, 1.55, and 1.85 eV" - These are the optical band gaps of the polymers.
